# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the implementation of the `add_yearmonth` function:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = DateTime.ymd.(df[:dt])
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input, creates a new column `ym`, and populates it with year-month integers derived from the `dt` column.

To use this function, simply call it after your DataFrame is defined:

```julia
# Assuming df is your existing DataFrame
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will create a new column `ym` in your DataFrame `df`.
